title: Tracking issue for `array_from_fn` and  `try_array_from_fn`

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
Provides the common use-case of creating custom arrays in a reliable and unified way. Particularly useful for elements that don't implement Copy, Clone or Default.

### Public API

```rust
// Stable (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/94119)
fn from_fn<F, T, const N: usize>(cb: F) -> [T; N]
where
    F: FnMut(usize) -> T;

// Unstable
fn try_from_fn<E, F, T, const N: usize>(cb: F) -> Result<[T; N], E>
where
    F: FnMut(usize) -> Result<T, E>;
```

### Steps / History

- [x] Implementation (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75644)
- [ ] Final comment period
- [ ] Stabilization PR

### Unresolved Questions

* ~~Should the callback return indices (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75644#discussion_r689066495) ?~~

* ~~`from_fn` and `try_from_fn` are very similar to `repeat_with` and `try_repeat_with` (#91613), just that they take unary instead of nullary functions. Anyone considering stabilizing these should think about those, and vice versa.~~
